actor_awards.notes: Perkins won the Best Actor award at the 1961 Cannes Film Festival for 'Goodbye Again' and a Golden Globe for New Star of the Year in 1957. He received a posthumous Donostia Lifetime Achievement Award in 1991.

filmography.title: Psycho
filmography.role_description: A shy, socially awkward motel owner dominated by his mother, whose dark secrets terrify a fugitive secretary.
filmography.plot: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.
filmography.awards: International Board of Motion Picture Reviewers: Win – Best Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Villains (#2)

filmography.title: Friendly Persuasion
filmography.role_description: The son of a Quaker family who struggles with his pacifist upbringing when the Civil War threatens his home.
filmography.plot: The pacifist attitude of a Quaker family is tested as a result of the American Civil War.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Most Promising Newcomer

filmography.title: The Trial
filmography.role_description: A bureaucrat who is arrested and prosecuted for an unspecified crime in a nightmarish, dystopian society.
filmography.plot: An unassuming office worker is arrested and stands trial, but he is never told what he is charged with.

filmography.title: Fear Strikes Out
filmography.role_description: The real-life Boston Red Sox baseball player who battles bipolar disorder and the intense pressure from his domineering father.
filmography.plot: The true story of baseball player Jimmy Piersall, who battles mental illness and the pressures of his father to succeed.

filmography.title: Pretty Poison
filmography.role_description: A disturbed ex-convict who manipulates a high school cheerleader into a fantasy world of espionage, only to find she is more dangerous than he is.
filmography.plot: A mentally disturbed man tells a high school girl he is a secret agent, but she turns the tables on him with her own deadly agenda.
filmography.awards: New York Film Critics Circle: Win – Best Screenplay

filmography.title: Goodbye Again
filmography.role_description: A young, immature American lawyer in Paris who falls in love with an older woman, played by Ingrid Bergman.
filmography.plot: A forty-year-old woman begins an affair with a much younger man to make her philandering lover jealous.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: The nervous secretary to the murder victim, Ratchett, who becomes a suspect in Hercule Poirot's investigation.
filmography.plot: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Supporting Actor (John Gielgud); Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Ingrid Bergman)

filmography.title: On the Beach
filmography.role_description: A young Australian naval officer and family man facing the end of the world from nuclear fallout.
filmography.plot: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Original Score

filmography.title: Catch-22
filmography.role_description: A timid, bullied army chaplain who befriends Yossarian and struggles with his faith amidst the absurdity of war.
filmography.plot: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

filmography.title: Psycho II
filmography.role_description: Perkins returns as Norman Bates, released from a mental institution after 22 years and trying to maintain his sanity while new murders occur.
filmography.plot: After twenty-two years of psychiatric care, Norman Bates attempts to return to a life of solitude, but the specters of his crimes continue to haunt him.

filmography.title: The Black Hole
filmography.role_description: A scientist on the USS Palomino who becomes entranced by the sinister Dr. Reinhardt's mission into a black hole.
filmography.plot: A research vessel finds a missing ship, commanded by a mysterious scientist, on the edge of a black hole.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Visual Effects

filmography.title: Play It as It Lays
filmography.role_description: A cynical, depressed Hollywood producer and the confidant of the troubled protagonist Maria.
filmography.plot: An unhappily married actress struggles to cope with life in Hollywood and her own mental instability.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actress (Tuesday Weld)

filmography.title: The Tin Star
filmography.role_description: An inexperienced young sheriff who learns the ropes from a veteran bounty hunter played by Henry Fonda.
filmography.plot: A bounty hunter helps a young sheriff who is having trouble with the local town bully.

filmography.title: Winter Kills
filmography.role_description: The head of a powerful family's surveillance and intelligence network in this satirical conspiracy thriller.
filmography.plot: The brother of a murdered US President discovers a new conspiracy behind the assassination 19 years later.

filmography.title: Phaedra
filmography.role_description: The son of a shipping tycoon who engages in a tragic affair with his stepmother, a modern retelling of the Greek myth.
filmography.plot: A wealthy shipping magnate's wife falls in love with her stepson, leading to tragedy.

filmography.title: Desire Under the Elms
filmography.role_description: A young farmer consumed by hatred for his father and desire for his new stepmother.
filmography.plot: A farmer's son falls in love with his father's new young wife, sparking a family conflict over land and inheritance.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nominated – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
filmography.role_description: An eccentric traveling preacher who encounters the legendary hanging judge.
filmography.plot: An outlaw establishes his own brand of law and order in a small town on the Texas border.

filmography.title: Mahogany
filmography.role_description: A possessive and brilliant fashion photographer who discovers and molds the title character into a supermodel.
filmography.plot: A struggling fashion design student from Chicago becomes a successful designer in Rome.

filmography.title: Crimes of Passion
filmography.role_description: A deranged street preacher who becomes obsessed with a woman leading a double life as a prostitute.
filmography.plot: A woman who works as a fashion designer by day and a prostitute by night is stalked by a psychotic preacher.

filmography.title: Tall Story
filmography.role_description: A college basketball star who becomes the target of a bribery scandal while being pursued romantically by Jane Fonda's character.
filmography.plot: A college student enrolls in a university specifically to find a husband, setting her sights on the star basketball player.

filmography.title: The Matchmaker
filmography.role_description: The head clerk who sneaks away to New York City for an adventure, in the film version of the play that later became 'Hello, Dolly!'.
filmography.plot: A wealthy merchant hires a matchmaker to find him a wife, but she decides to marry him herself.

filmography.title: Psycho III
filmography.role_description: Perkins directs and stars as Norman Bates, who falls in love with a fallen nun while the Bates Motel is once again open for business.
filmography.plot: Norman Bates falls in love with a nun who visits the Bates Motel, but his mother's spirit continues to torment him.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: Is Paris Burning?
filmography.role_description: An American soldier involved in the liberation of Paris during World War II.
filmography.plot: The story of the liberation of Paris by the French Resistance and the Free French Forces in August 1944.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Art Direction, Best Cinematography

filmography.title: The Champagne Murders
filmography.role_description: A man caught up in a series of murders involving a champagne dynasty in this French thriller directed by Claude Chabrol.
filmography.plot: A series of murders plagues a champagne business, and the owner is forced to sell his company.

filmography.title: Edge of Sanity
filmography.role: Dr. Henry Jekyll / Jack 'The Ripper' Hyde
filmography.role_description: A lurid dual role combining the classic Jekyll and Hyde story with the Jack the Ripper legend.
filmography.plot: Dr. Jekyll's experiments with cocaine turn him into the murderous Jack Hyde, who stalks the streets of London.

filmography.title: WUSA
filmography.role_description: A naive social worker who uncovers a sinister plot by a right-wing radio station in New Orleans.
filmography.plot: A drifter gets a job as an announcer for a right-wing radio station in New Orleans and becomes involved in a political conspiracy.

filmography.title: Green Mansions
filmography.role_description: A fugitive who flees to the Venezuelan jungle and falls in love with a mysterious girl named Rima.
filmography.plot: A young man seeking gold in the South American jungle discovers a girl who can talk to birds and animals.

filmography.title: The Actress
filmography.role_description: The suitor of the main character, Ruth Gordon, in this autobiographical film about her early life.
filmography.plot: A young woman is determined to become an actress despite her father's objections.
